FuncDef: This command verifies the reachability of a remote host.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the far-end IP address to which to send the svc-ping request message in dotted decimal notation.
Specifies the DNS name of the far-end device to which to send the svc-ping request message, expressed as a character string.
Specifies that packets will be generated as fast as possible instead of the default 1 per second.
Displays detailed information.
Specifies the TTL value for the MPLS label, expressed as a decimal integer. Values-1 to 128.
Specifies the service type. Values-0 to 255.
Specifies the request packet size in bytes, expressed as a decimal integer. Values-0 to 16384.

Specifies the date portion in a ping packet will be filled with the pattern value specified. If not specified, position info will be filled instead. Values-0 to 65535. ParamDefault: Default- system-generated sequential pattern.
Specifies the IP address to be used.
Specifies the routing instance or service, by number. The router-instance parameter is preferred for specifying the router or service. Values-{router-name | vprn-svc-id}. ParamDefault: Default- Base
Specifies the alias function that allows the service-name to be used, converted and stored as service ID.

Specifies the preferred method for entering a service name. Stored as the service name. Only service linking function that is allowed for both mixed-mode and model-driven configuration modes. Values-{router-name | vprn-svc-name}.
Specifies whether to send the ping request to a host on a directly attached network bypassing the routing table.
Specifies the name of an IP interface. The name must already exist in the config>router>interface context.
Displays only static routes with the specified next hop IP address.

Specifies the number of times to perform an OAM ping probe operation. Each OAM echo message request must either timeout or receive a reply before the next message request is sent. Values-1 to 100000. ParamDefault: Default- 5
Sets the DF (Do Not Fragment) bit in the ICMP ping packet (does not apply to ICMPv6).

Overrides the default timeout value and is the amount of time that the router will wait for a message reply after sending the message request. Upon the expiration of message timeout, the requesting router assumes that the message response will not be received. A  request timeout  message is displayed by the CLI for each message request sent that expires. Any response received after the request times out will be silently discarded. Values-1 to 10. ParamDefault: Default- 5
Specifies the timeout, in seconds. Values-1 to 10.

Specifies the L2-Aware NAT subscriber to which ICMP-ping is sent, up to 32 characters. The subscriber-id keyword serves as a differentiator between the subscribers with the same IP address in the same routing context (which is allowed in L2-Aware NAT). The subscriber-id keyword is mandatory for L2-Aware IPv4 ping, but optional in generic ping framework.
